intro: Bottegoa, commonly known as the "butterfly plant," is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the genus Cineraria, which is part of the Asteraceae family. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, daisy-like flowers that come in shades of blue, violet, and white. Its leaves are typically velvety and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Bottegoa thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
